notes: Does not share cooldown with Quelling Blade or Iron Talon.
Stacks with the Quell of Quelling Blade, but not with additional Battle Furies.
When the owner's attack type changes to ranged or melee, the attack damage bonus adapts immediately.
Quell fully works with crits, cleave, splash, and lifesteal.
When attacking creeps, Quell also causes cleave, splash, Psi Blades, and Moon Glaives to deal more damage to every unit they hit.
Does not work against wards, buildings, illusions, Spirit Bear, and allied units. Works against Roshan.
abilities.description: Increases attack damage against non-hero units by 18 for melee heroes, and 6 for ranged.

notes: Cleave damage cannot be amplified with spell damage amplification and cannot spell lifesteal.
Cleave damage is reduced by Damage Block.
The complete area is shaped like an isosceles trapezoid in front of the attacking hero.
Fully stacks with other sources of cleaves. Each source of cleave works completely independent.
Does not cleave upon attacking wards, buildings or allied units. Wards and buildings are unaffected by cleave.
Despite the visual effect, cleave damage is applied instantly in the whole area.
abilities.description: Deals 70% of attack damage as physical damage in a cone up to 650 around the target. Deals 50% against creeps. (Melee Only)

name: Battle Fury
description: The bearer of this mighty axe gains the ability to cut down swaths of enemies at once.
trivia: Faceless Void's cosmetic item, Battlefury, is based on Battle Fury.
tips: The Battle Fury is great tool for farming but a poor choice for mid game skirmishes owing to its lack of primary attributes. Avoid it if the enemy team plays aggressively and your presence is required in team fights early.

Effective against illusions, summoned units, jungle stacks, ancient stacks and mega creeps. A Battle Fury allows a melee hero to farm faster than a Midas. You can get this item after boots start with a ring of regen if you are laning or get damage if you are jungling, then get a mobility item like Blink Dagger to reach camps faster.

A Battle Fury allows a melee hero to farm faster than a Midas. You can get this item after boots start with a ring of regen if you are laning or get damage if you are jungling, then get a mobility item like Blink Dagger to reach camps faster.
The cleave benefits from critical hits, including those from items and ignores evasion.
Having Battle Fury can help greatly against an enemy Nature's Prophet, since some carries have little means to escape his Sprout without it (the most obvious being Juggernaut and Troll Warlord)
Melee heroes with high attack speed can push far more effectively with Battle Fury, even in late game. Critical hits help too.
